atDirectives.name: @source
atDirectives.description: Use the `@source` directive to specify file paths that Tailwind should scan for class names in v4. This replaces the `content` array from the config file.

atDirectives.name: @theme
atDirectives.description: Use the `@theme` directive to define custom theme values inline in your CSS. This replaces the `theme` object from the config file in v4.

atDirectives.name: @tailwind
atDirectives.description: Use the `@tailwind` directive to insert Tailwind's `base`, `components`, `utilities` and `screens` styles into your CSS.

atDirectives.name: @apply
atDirectives.description: Use the `@apply` directive to inline any existing utility classes into your own custom CSS. This is useful when you find a common utility pattern in your HTML that you'd like to extract to a new component.

atDirectives.name: @layer
atDirectives.description: Use the `@layer` directive to tell Tailwind which 'bucket' a set of custom styles belong to. Valid layers are `base`, `components`, and `utilities`.

atDirectives.name: @variant
atDirectives.description: Use the `@variant` directive to define custom variants in Tailwind CSS v4.

atDirectives.name: @custom-variant
atDirectives.description: Use the `@custom-variant` directive to define custom variants with CSS selectors in Tailwind CSS v4.

atDirectives.name: @screen
atDirectives.description: The `@screen` directive allows you to create media queries that reference your breakpoints by **name** instead of duplicating their values in your own CSS.
